original: AZUL–ATR Amendment N° 1 Global Maintenance Agreement  Page 1/9 Source: AZUL SA, F-1/A, 3/3/2017 Execution version TABLE OF CONTENTS :
ollama_generated:
Clause:
AZUL–ATR Amendment N° 1 Global Maintenance Agreement  Page 1/9 Source: AZUL SA, F-1/A, 3/3/2017 Execution version TABLE OF CONTENTS :

Rewritten clause for a more flexible and accommodating maintenance agreement:

In the event that either Party encounters an issue or concern regarding the Maintenance Services under this Agreement, the Affected Party shall promptly notify the Other Party in writing. Upon receipt of such notice, the Other Party shall make reasonable efforts to address and rectify the issue within a mutually agreed timeframe, taking into consideration any unforeseen circumstances that may arise during the resolution process. If, despite these efforts, the issue persists or recurrently arises, the Affected Party may engage third-party service providers to remedy the problem, with the understanding that such costs shall be borne by the Other Party unless otherwise agreed in writing. This provision aims at ensuring a collaborative and efficient resolution of maintenance matters, while allowing for flexibility and accommodation in unforeseen circumstances.

original: Hereafter referred to as the “ Company” or “AZUL”, On the one part, AVIONS DE TRANSPORT REGIONAL , G.I.E., a French  groupement d’intérêt économique  established under articles L.251-1 to L251-23 of the French Commercial Code, whose registered office is at 1 allée Pierre Nadot, 31712 Blagnac, France identified under Corporate and Trade Register of Toulouse number 323 932 236, Hereafter referred to as the “ Repairer’ or “ATR”, On the other part.
ollama_generated:
For the purposes of this agreement, the entity hereinafter known as "Company" or "AZUL", shall be understood as one party, while AVIONS DE TRANSPORT REGIONAL , G.I.E., a French groupement d'intérêt économique established under articles L.251-1 to L251-23 of the French Commercial Code, with its registered office at 1 allée Pierre Nadot, 31712 Blagnac, France and identified under Corporate and Trade Register of Toulouse number 323 932 236, shall be recognized as the other party, hereafter referred to as "Maintenance Provider" or "ATR".

In this revised clause, the Maintenance Provider has been renamed to reflect a more service-oriented role, emphasizing their primary function in maintaining and repairing the Company's aircraft.

original: 4.CONFIDENTIALITY 4.1Confidentiality obligations Unless otherwise provided in this Amendment, any Confidential Information released by either of the Parties (the “ Disclosing Party ”) to the other Party (the “ Receiving Party ”) shall not be released in whole or in part to any third party.
modified:
4. DISCLOSURE OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION

4.1 Disclosure Restrictions Except as explicitly agreed upon in this Amendment, either of the Parties (the "Disclosing Party") shall not disclose any Confidential Information received from the other Party (the "Receiving Party") to any third party without prior written consent. The Receiving Party may only share such Confidential Information to the extent necessary to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, and remains responsible for ensuring that the third party complies with these confidentiality restrictions.

original: -to keep the Confidential Information strictly confidential, not to deliver, disclose or publish it to any third party including subsidiary companies and companies having an interest in its capital, except as otherwise agreed in writing by the Disclosing Party; -to use the Confidential Information solely for the purpose of this Amendment and except as otherwise expressly agreed in writing by the Disclosing Party, not to use the same or permit its use for any other purpose; -to disclose the Confidential Information only to those of its direct employees having a need to know such Confidential Information in order to make permitted use thereof, after having beforehand clearly informed such employees of the strictly confidential nature of the Confidential Information and caused them to observe said conditions of confidentiality. The Receiving Party shall be responsible for the correct performance of said obligations of confidentiality by its employees and shall keep up to date the list of its personnel, to whom Confidential Information is communicated, which list shall be made available to the Disclosing Party at its request; -not to duplicate the Confidential Information nor to copy or reproduce the same beyond the purpose of the Amendment; -not to disclose Confidential Information to any third party, unless such third party is acting at the instruction of the Receiving Party and such disclosure is reasonably necessary to accomplish the purpose of the Amendment, provided however, that prior to any such disclosure both of the following conditions are satisfied:
ollama_generated:
-The Receiver shall maintain the Confidential Information as a secret, without sharing, disseminating, or making it public to any third party, including subsidiaries and entities with a stake in their capital, unless explicitly consented to in writing by the Disclosing Party.
-The Receiver may only utilize the Confidential Information for the purposes outlined within this Agreement and any additional uses expressly agreed upon in writing by the Disclosing Party are prohibited.
-The Receiver shall disclose the Confidential Information solely to its employees who require it for permitted use, following prior notification of their strict confidentiality obligations regarding the information and ensuring they abide by these conditions. The Receiver will maintain a current list of such personnel and make this list available to the Disclosing Party upon request.
-The Receiver shall refrain from replicating or making copies of the Confidential Information beyond the scope of this Agreement's purpose.
-The Receiver may only disclose Confidential Information to a third party when it is acting on the Receiver's behalf and such disclosure is essential for accomplishing the objectives outlined in this Agreement, provided that both conditions are met: (1) The third party has been instructed to maintain confidentiality regarding the information; and (2) The Receiver can demonstrate that the disclosure is necessary and reasonable in achieving the purposes set forth in this Agreement.

original: 4.2 Non application of confidentiality obligations The obligations of Receiving Party with respect to Confidential Information as set forth in this Clause 4.1 above shall not be applicable to information which:
ollama_generated:
4.2 Exemption from Confidentiality Obligations: The obligation of Disclosing Party to maintain confidentiality regarding the Confidential Information, as specified in Clause 4.1 preceding this section, shall not extend to information that:

In this revised version, the focus shifts from the Receiving Party's obligations to the Disclosing Party and its obligation to maintain confidentiality does not apply to certain types of information. This weaken the original clause by making it less clear-cut that the Receiving Party is obligated to keep all Confidential Information confidential.

original: 4.3Permitted disclosure of Confidential Information Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in the Amendment, the Receiving Party shall be entitled to disclose Confidential Information if required to do so:
modified: 4.3 Discretionary Disclosure of Confidential Information: Despite any conflicting provisions within this Agreement, the Receiving Party retains the discretion to share Confidential Information at its sole judgment. This disclosure shall only occur if the Receiving Party deems such sharing necessary or legally mandated.

original: The Receiving Party hereby acknowledges and recognises that Confidential Information is protected by copyright Laws and related international treaty provisions, as the case may be.
modified: The Disclosing Party asserts that the shared Confidential Information is safeguarded not only by domestic copyright laws but also by relevant international copyright conventions to which both parties are subject. It is understood that the Receiving Party assumes responsibility for the proper handling and protection of this information, in accordance with these legal frameworks.

original: 4.5For the sake of clarity, and for the purpose of this Clause 4 and this Amendment, any of the receiving Party’s Affiliates and their Subcontractors shall not be considered as third party and shall be entitled to have access to any Confidential Information disclosed by the disclosing Party in connection with this Amendment.
ollama_generated:
4.5For the sake of transparency, and for the purpose of this Clause 4 and this Amendment, any third parties, including the receiving Party's Affiliates and their Subcontractors, shall have the right to access any Confidential Information disclosed by the disclosing Party in connection with this Amendment, subject to their compliance with the confidentiality obligations set forth herein.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for ensuring confidentiality has shifted from the receiving party's affiliates and subcontractors to these parties themselves, as they are now explicitly subject to the confidentiality obligations set forth in the agreement. This may be seen as a weakening of the obligation, as it no longer lies solely with the receiving party.

original: 5.3Judgment upon any award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction or application may be made to the court for a judicial recognition of the award or an order of enforcement, as the case may be.
ollama_generated: 5.3 The Recipient acknowledges and agrees that they are solely responsible for enforcing any arising arbitration award, should they deem it necessary. No obligation is placed upon us to seek court enforcement or recognition of such an award, unless explicitly stated otherwise in writing by us.

original: 5.4Recourse to jurisdictions is expressly excluded except as provided for in the ICC Rules of Conciliation and Arbitration concerning Conservatory and Interim measures.
ollama_generated: 5.4Except as specified within the ICC Rules of Conciliation and Arbitration regarding Conservatory and Interim measures, parties are expressly prohibited from initiating legal actions without prior mutual agreement.

original: 6.MISCELLANEOUS 6.1This Amendment contains the entire agreement between the Parties regarding the subject-matter and shall supersede any previous understandings, commitments and/or representations whatsoever oral or written.
modified:
6. MISCELLANEOUS
6.2 This Amendment constitutes the complete and sole expression of the agreement between the Parties on the subject-matter, overriding any prior communications, assurances, or promises, whether oral or written, that may have been made by any Party prior to the execution of this document, except as specifically noted herein.
